story.text: WASHINGTON Jan 3 Oculus Innovative Sciences Inc., a maker of products to help prevent infection in chronic and acute wounds, on Wednesday raised the number of shares for its planned initial public offering to 3.5 million from 3.1 million. It also lowered the estimated price range to between $8 and $10 per share from $12 to $14, according to an amended offering document filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. The underwriters, led by Roth Capital Partners, will have the option to buy more than 460,000 additional shares to cover over-allotments. The Petaluma, California-based company said it has been approved to list its stock on Nasdaq under the symbol "OCLS" (OCLS.O).
story.title: oculus raises ipo size , lowers price range
